intro: Cerastium brachypetalum subsp. luridum, commonly known as the yellow mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant has hairy, linear leaves and produces capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. It typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it well adapted to cool, temperate climates.
